article_text: Proponents say a “schedules that work” law would help part-time workers have more predictable shifts, making it easier to plan family activities and possibly hold a second part-time job. Opponents say the proposal ignores the variability of business staffing needs and is an unwanted government intrusion.

article_metadata.news-keywords: schedules that work, part-time jobs, work/life balance, NELP, CLASP, H.R. 5159
article_metadata.title: Efforts advance to stabilize the schedules of part-time workers | The Kansas City Star

Opponents say the proposal ignores the variability of business staffing needs and is an unwanted government intrusion.
Proponents say a “schedules that work” law would help part-time workers have more predictable shifts, making it easier to plan family activities and possibly hold a second part-time job.
